WorkItem.Description:
When attempting to install Typescript 0.9.1.1, the Visual Studio update installer opens with the error message: "This version of Visual Studio requires a computer with a newer version of Windows."

The words 'newer version of Windows' are a clickable link which takes me to the VS2013 preview download page.

I am currently running Windows 7 Professional x64, and Visual Studio 2012 Ultimate.

The download info here: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=34790 says that both Windows 7 and VS2012 Ultimate are supported by the plugin.

This appears to be a bug in the installer.

Thanks for your time!
WorkItem.Summary: Visual Studio requires a computer with a newer version of Windows.

Comments.Message: Is your system completely up to date (SP1, any additional updates)? Same for Visual Studio (Tools > Extensions and Updates...)

Checking now - VS is up to date, though I'm installing a nuGet update just to be safe.

I don't have Win7 SP1. Seems like it may be the culprit (thought I had it installed already along with the other 106 important updates when I reinstalled my OS, haha.) Downloading it now, I'll reply once I install it and let you know if that fixes it.

Thanks for the quick response!

Yep, that did the trick. Thanks a bunch for the quick response.

No bug, just an error message with not enough detail. Perhaps the download page should specify Windows 7 SP1 in the system requirements? Might prevent others from bumping up against this in the future.

Thanks a lot for your help!
